poem:
Title: "The Sunflower in Winter's Grip"

In the strife of giants, Ukraine,
merely a dancing sunflower--
in Europeans' unfaithful eye,
such confidence wavers, falters,
slips below ten percent.

Yet, hope, bound by no poll,
nursed by the summer streams,
compromise the fruit unseen.
It sleeps beneath the snow and steel,
waiting for the resonation
of peace's distant bell.
